Conversely, a high intake of n-6 fatty acids has, in animal studies, been associated with adverse effects on 
appetite regulation and energy metabolism in offspring [46]. However, any influence of dietary fatty acid intake 
during pregnancy on the risk of NCDs in humans remains to be d
